Text: Alif Lam M'im.
Do the people think that they will be left alone on saying "We\n\t\t\tbelieve," and that they will not be tested?
We did test those who have gone before them. Allah has to see\n\t\t\t(for the purpose of reward and punishment) who are the truthful\n\t\t\tand who are the liars.
Or do the evildoers think that they will escape from Our reach?\n\t\t\tHow bad is their judgment!
He that hopes to meet Allah must know that Allah's appointed time\n\t\t\tis sure to come and He hears all and knows all.
He that strives, does that for his own soul; for Allah is\n\t\t\tcertainly transcendent and beyond any need of the worlds.
As for those who believe and do good deeds, We shall cleanse them\n\t\t\tof their sins and We shall reward them according to the best of\n\t\t\ttheir deeds.

We have enjoined man to show kindness to his parents; but if they
			(your parents) force you to commit shirk with Me, of which you
			have no knowledge, do not obey them. To Me is your return and I
			will inform you of what you have done.
Those who have accepted the true faith and do good deeds shall be\n\t\t\tadmitted among the righteous.

There are some among people, who say: "We believe in Allah;" yet
			when they suffer in the cause of Allah they confuse the
			persecution of people with the punishment of Allah. But when
			there comes help in the shape of a victory from your Rabb, they
			are sure to say: "We have always been with you." Is not Allah
			fully aware of what is in the hearts of the people of the world?
Most surely Allah knows those who believe and knows those who are\n\t\t\tthe hypocrites.
The unbelievers say to the believers: "Follow us, and we will\n\t\t\tbear the burden of your sins". But they will not bear any burden\n\t\t\tof their sins; they are surely lying.

Of course, they shall bear their own burdens as well as the\n\t\t\tburdens of others in addition to their own; and on the Day of\n\t\t\tResurrection they shall be questioned about their invented lies.
We sent Nuh (Noah) to his people and he lived among them a\n\t\t\tthousand years less fifty. Then because of their wrongdoings the\n\t\t\tflood overtook them.
But We delivered him and all who were in the ark and We made that\n\t\t\tark a sign for the peoples of the world.
Likewise Ibrahim (Abraham), when he said to his people: "Worship\n\t\t\tAllah and fear Him, this is better for you if you understand.

You worship idols besides Allah and fabricate falsehood. In fact,
			those whom you worship besides Allah have no power to give you
			your sustenance, therefore seek your sustenance from Allah, and
			worship Him. Give thanks to Him, for to Him you shall be
			returned.
If you deny the Message, then nations have denied before you .\n\t\t\tThe only duty a Rasool has is to deliver Allah's Message\n\t\t\tclearly."
Do they not see how Allah originates creation then repeats its\n\t\t\tprocess? Surely it is easy for Allah.
Say to them: "Travel through the earth and see how Allah\n\t\t\toriginates the creation, then creates the later creation. Surely\n\t\t\tAllah has power over everything.
He punishes whom He wills and shows mercy to whom He pleases, and\n\t\t\tto Him you shall be turned back.
Neither can you frustrate Him in the earth or in the Heaven; nor\n\t\t\thave you any protector or helper besides Allah."

As for those who disbelieve Allah's revelations and deny that\n\t\t\tthey will ever meet Him, they are the ones who shall despair of\n\t\t\tMy mercy and they the ones who shall have a painful punishment.

The people of Ibrahim (Abraham) had no answer except to say:
			"Kill him!" Or "Burn him!" But Allah saved him from the fire when
			they tried to burn him. Surely in this incidence there are signs
			for those who believe.

After coming out from the fire safely, Ibrahim addressed them:
			"Today you have made idols, instead of Allah, a means of
			affection among yourselves. Remember, on the Day of Resurrection
			you shall disown and curse one another. Fire shall be your abode
			and you shall have no helper."

Witnessing this whole incident, Lut (Lot) affirmed his belief
			with Ibrahim. Finally Ibrahim said: "I will migrate towards my
			Rabb (go where my Rabb has bidden me). He is the Mighty, the
			Wise."

We gave him Ishaq (Isaac - a son) and Ya'qoob (Jacob - a
			grandson), and placed the Prophethood and the Book in his progeny
			- thus We gave him his reward in this life, and in the hereafter
			he will surely be among the righteous.
When Lut (Lot) said to his people: "Surely you are committing\n\t\t\tsuch sexual misconduct as no one in the worlds has ever attempted\n\t\t\tbefore you.

Do you lust after males, commit robbery on the highways and
			commit evil deeds even in your assemblies?" His people had no
			answer except to say: "Bring us the scourge of Allah if you are
			truthful."
Lut prayed: "O Rabb! Help me against this degenerate nation."

When Our Messengers (angels) came to Ibrahim (Abraham) with the
			good news (the birth of a son in his old age), they said: "We are
			to destroy the people of that township, for its people are indeed
			wrongdoers."
Ibrahim said: "But Lut is in there." The angels replied: "We know\n\t\t\twho is in there: we shall certainly save him and his family,\n\t\t\texcept his wife, who will remain behind!"

And when Our Messengers (angels) came to Lut he became sad and
			anxious on their account, for he felt powerless to protect them.
			But they said "Do not fear nor grieve (we are the angels assigned
			for their torment): we shall save you and your family except your
			wife; she will be of those who will remain behind.
We are going to bring down a scourge from heaven upon the people\n\t\t\tof this town on account of their transgression."
Surely We have left a clear sign from it (the ruins of this town)\n\t\t\tfor people who care to understand.
To the people of Madyan We sent their brother Shu'aib, who said:\n\t\t\t"O my people! Worship Allah and look forward to the Last Day, and\n\t\t\tdo not transgress in the land wickedly."
But they denied him, so a severe earthquake seized them and by\n\t\t\tthe morning they were lifeless bodies in their own homes.

Likewise We destroyed the people of 'Ad and the Thamud: you have
			seen the traces of their dwellings. Shaitan had made their foul
			deeds fair-seeming to them and diverted them from the Right Way,
			though they were intelligent people.
Musa (Moses) came to Qarun (Korah), Fir'on (Pharaoh) and Haman\n\t\t\twith clear signs but they remained arrogant in the land; yet they\n\t\t\tcould not go ahead of Us.

We seized all of them for their sinfulness: against some We sent
			a violent tornado full of stones, some were seized by a mighty
			blast, some were swallowed up by the earth, and yet some We
			drowned. It was not Allah Who was unjust to them, but they were
			unjust to their own souls.

The parable of those who take protectors other than Allah is that
			of a spider who builds for itself a dwelling, and surely the
			weakest of all dwellings is the dwelling of a spider, if they but
			knew it.
Surely Allah knows whoever they invoke besides Him; He is the\n\t\t\tAll-Mighty, the Wise.
These are the parables that We cite for mankind; but none will\n\t\t\tgrasp them except the wise.
Allah has created the heavens and the earth to manifest the\n\t\t\tTruth. Surely in this there is a sign for the believers.

Recite from this Book (Al-Qur'an) which has been revealed to you
			and establish Salah (Islamic prayers). Surely Salah keeps one
			away from shameful and evil deeds; and surely the remembrance of
			Allah (during your prayers and Allah's mention of your name in
			response to your prayers) is the greatest of all deeds, Allah
			knows what you do.

Do not argue with the People of the Book except in good taste -
			except with those who are wicked among them - and say: "We
			believe in that which is sent down to us and that which is sent
			down to you; Our God and your God is the same One God to Whom we
			submit as Muslims."

O Prophet, We have sent down this Book to you (similar to that of
			Musa and Isa). So the People of the Book believe in it, and so do
			some of these (people of Arabia): and none but unbelievers deny
			Our revelations.
O Muhammad, you have never read a book before this nor have you\n\t\t\tever transcribed one with your right hand. Had you done either of\n\t\t\tthese, the quibblers could suspect it.
Rather, these are clear signs in the breast of those who are\n\t\t\tendowed with knowledge: and none deny Our signs except the\n\t\t\twrongdoers.
They ask: "Why have the signs not been sent down to him from his\n\t\t\tRabb?" Tell them: "The signs are in the hands of Allah. I am only\n\t\t\ta plain Warner."
Is it not enough for them that We have sent down to you this Book\n\t\t\t(AL-Qur'an) which is recited to them, surely in it is a blessing\n\t\t\tand a reminder for those who believe.

Tell them: "Allah is sufficient as a witness between me and you -
			for He knows all that is in the heavens and the earth - those who
			believe in falsehood and disbelieve Allah, it is they who shall
			be the losers."
They challenge you to hasten the scourge on them. Had a time not\n\t\t\tbeen fixed for it, the scourge would already have overtaken them.\n\t\t\tIt is going to come suddenly and catch them unaware.
They challenge you to hasten the scourge, whereas hell has\n\t\t\talready encircled the unbelievers.
On that Day the punishment shall cover them from above and from\n\t\t\tbeneath their feet, and Allah will say: "Now taste the reward of\n\t\t\tyour deeds."
O My servants who have believed! Surely My earth is spacious to\n\t\t\tmigrate if needed, therefore worship Me and Me Alone.
Every soul shall taste death, then to Us you shall all return.

Those who embrace true faith and do good deeds shall be lodged in
			the mansions of paradise beneath which the rivers flow, to live
			therein forever. What an excellent reward for the doers of good
			deeds;
the ones who have shown patience and put their trust in their\n\t\t\tRabb.
How many creatures are there that do not carry their provisions\n\t\t\twith them? Allah provides for them as He provides for you. It is\n\t\t\tHe Who is All-hearing, All-knowing.

If you ask the disbelievers as to who has created the heavens and
			the earth, and subjected the sun and the moon to His laws? They
			will certainly say: "Allah!" How are they then being deluded away
			from the truth?
Allah gives abundantly to whom He pleases and sparingly to whom\n\t\t\tHe wills; surely Allah has knowledge of all things.

And if you ask them who sends down rainwater from the sky and
			thereby raise the dead land back to life?" They will certainly
			say: "Allah!" Say, "Praise be to Allah!" Yet most of them do not
			use their common sense.
The life of this world is nothing but pastime and play! It is the\n\t\t\tlife of the hereafter that is the true life: if they but knew it.

If they embark on a ship, and the ship gets into trouble, they
			call upon Allah, being sincerely obedient to Him; but when He
			brings them safely to land, they start committing shirk (giving
			credit for their safe arrival to others);
so that they may become ungrateful for the blessing that We have\n\t\t\tbestowed on them and enjoy the life of this world! They will soon\n\t\t\tcome to know the result of this behavior.

Do they not see that We have made for them a secure sanctuary in
			the Ka'bah, while the people are being snatched away from all
			around them? Do they still believe in falsehood and deny the
			blessings of Allah?
And who is more wicked than the one who forges a lie against\n\t\t\tAllah or rejects the Truth when it reaches him? Is not the hell a\n\t\t\tfitting abode for such disbelievers?
As for those who strive in Our cause, We will surely guide them\n\t\t\tto Our ways; rest assured that Allah is with the righteous.
